content: **pattern notes** the hofgarten shawl is a celebration of texture color and graceful shaping a piece as charming and inviting as the munich garden it s named after designed especially for the munich knits this shawl was an incredible honor and a true joy to create worked in three colors of fingering weight yarn hofgarten combines classic and modern techniques into a fluid crescent shape that drapes beautifully around the shoulders the design flows through relaxing garter stitch simple brioche playful short row and delicate feather and fan each section adding a unique rhythm and visual interest to your knitting journey whether you re strolling through blooming gardens or cozying up with your yarn at home this shawl invites you to enjoy the artistry of stitches and color in motion **one size - finished measurements** wingspan 86 5″ / 220 cm depth at widest point 20″ / 51 cm **gauge** 22 sts and 36 row per 4 10 cm in garter stitch after blocking gauge is not essential however with a different gauge actual finished measurements and total yardage will change **suggested yarn** dye dye done yaka 60% merino 20% silk 20% yak 100g/ 400 yards 366 meters or any fingering weight yarn that knits up to gauge you will need 3 colors 1 skein or approx 380 yards 350 meters in color 1 c1 1 skein or approx 340 yards 310 meters in color 2 c2 and 1 skein or approx 200 yards 185 meters in color 3 c3 the sample is made with colorways „curcuma c1 „baby elephant c2 and „cyclamen c3 **needles** us 2½ 3 mm 40 100 cm circular needle or in size to obtain gauge **notions** stitch markers tapestry needle
